HK:  1  local  infection  among  16  new  cases,  tally  at  989. A  28-year-old  man  tested  positive  for  the  disease  on  Friday  was  believed  to  be  linked  to  the  city’s  largest  infection  cluster  involving  several  bars.
Ban  on  crowds  urged  as  HK  virus  cases  hit  410. Halting  alcohol  sales  at  restaurants  and  bars  would  be  ineffective  in  reducing  all  types  of  social  gatherings,  experts  say.

Touching  the  green,  green  grass  of  home. Hong  Kong  has  much  to  offer  in  taking  green  projects  to  a  new  level,  like  helping  investors  to  build  up  a  diversified  and  sustainable  portfolio.

CE  to  meet  Japan  PM,  attend  GBA  forum  in  Tokyo  next  week. Carrie  Lam  will  attend  a  symposium  on  the  Greater  Bay  Area  and  meet  Japan's  PM  Shinzo  Abe  and  foreign  minister  Taro  Kono  during  her  April  7-9  trip.

US  bill  on  HK  meddles  with  China's  internal  affairs. US  congressional  committees  blatantly  meddled  with  China's  internal  affairs  when  they  approved  a  HK-related  bill  earlier  in  the  week,  legal  experts  said.
Coronavirus:  HK  braces  for  possible  community  outbreak. Four  infections  with  unknown  sources  trigger  alarm  over  mass  infection  as  1st  fatality  emerges.

Murder  suspect  released,  HK  rejects  Taiwan's  request. Taiwan's  request  to  send  law  enforcement  officers  to  HK  to  fetch  a  fugitive  murder  suspect  has  been  turned  down  by  the  HKSAR  govt  Wednesday.
Accountant  group  condemns  violence,  appeals  for  calm. Some  500  accountants  called  for  dialogues  in  a  joint  statement  published  on  local  newspaper  Sing  Tao  Daily  on  Friday.

Election  watchdog:  LegCo  poll  nominations  to  start. The  nomination  period  for  the  2020  Legislative  Council  General  Election  will  start  on  Saturday  and  run  until  July  31,  the  Election  Affairs  Commission  said.

MTR  wades  through  floods  of  crises. HK's  sole  rail  operator,  which  has  been  a  key  target  of  rioters  in  the  current  unrest,  is  battling  against  all  odds  to  maintain  its  high  efficiency.
Experts:  Beijing  wants  HK  to  get  back  on  track. Beijing  wants  Hong  Kong  people  to  put  aside  their  differences  and  to  work  together.

S.  Korea  looking  into  HK  hedge  fund  that  halted  withdrawals. Regulators  are  reviewing  the  suspension  of  client  redemptions  totaling  at  least    US$536  million  by  Gen2  Partners,  people  familiar  with  the  matter  said.

Violence  flares  as  protests  enter  10th  week  in  HK. The  HKSAR  government  and  police  condemned  the  illegal  assemblies  and  said  police  will  strictly  enforce  the  law  against  all  violent  and  illegal  acts.

UNICEF  HK  to  help  children  fight  novel  coronavirus. UNICEF  HK  will  provide  hygiene  bags  to  children  from  low-income  families  amid  growing  concerns  over  the  safety  of  students  with  classes  due  to  resume  next  month.

CE  says  violence  not  a  solution,  regrets  foreign  meddling  in  HK. Stressing  that  the  govt  was  resolute  in  its  attempts  to  build  a  platform  for  dialogue,  CE  Lam  said  an  escalation  of  violence  cannot  solve  social  issues.

HK  'losing  its  crown  in  luxury  Swiss  watch  market'. HK's  position  as  the  largest  market  for  Swiss  watch  exports  won't  last  as  other  regions  see  accelerated  growth,  the  chief  of  top  brand  Officine  Panerai  said.
175  district  councilors  condemn  FCC,  Andy  Chan. Representatives  of  all  nine  New  Territories  districts  sign  statement.

Hang  Seng  rises  for  7  weeks  in  a  row,  hits  record  high. At  close  of  trade,  the  HSI  was  up  499.67  points  or  1.53%  at  33,154.12.  The  Hang  Seng  China  Enterprises  index  rose  2.51%.
Stopping  the  violence:  Call  for  a  united  front. Legal  experts  say  consensus  needed  to  safeguard  HK's  rule  of  law.

Tung:  No  compromise  over  acts  of  violence. Former  chief  executive  Tung  Chee-hwa  said  there  is“no  compromise”when  dealing  with  the  "black  sheep"  bent  on  destabilizing  HK  through  violence.

HKSAR  govt  says  EU  measures  'misguided'. According  to  EU  data,  the  total  merchandise  trade  between  the  EU  and  HK  amounted  to  48b  euro,  with  the  EU  enjoying  a  trade  surplus  of  25.4b  euro.
Hong  Kong  stocks  close  0.31%  higher. Hong  Kong  stocks  closed  up  88.41  points,  or  0.31  percent,  to  28,204.69  points.

Lee:  Public  has  role  to  play  in  safeguarding  national  security. Secretary  for  Security  John  Lee  Ka-chiu  said  the  SAR  and  its  people  have  the  responsibility  and  obligation  to  safeguard  national  security.
Study  shows  HK  people  spending  more  time  e-reading. Survey  also  finds  that  reading  e-books  is  still  not  popular  in  city.

Tin  Ka-ping's  philanthropic  spirit  'will  live  on'. Those  who  have  benefited  from  the  late  Hong  Kong  philanthropist  Tin  Ka-ping's  donations  said  his  legacy  would  passed  on  from  generation  to  generation.

Building  the  HK  brand  across  frontiers. Precision  marketing  is  one  of  the  most  mature  fields  of  AI  commercialization.  In  the  third  part  of  the  series,  Oswald  Chan  tells  how  enterprises  implement  advertising  campaigns  by  mining  and  extracting  the  relevant  data.  However,  the  intricate  issue  of  STEM  talent  shortage  must  be  tackled.

Experts:  Law  allots  roles  in  HK  properly. Experts  said  there's  no  need  to  worry  that  Hong  Kong's  judicial  autonomy  or  human  rights  will  be  threatened  now  that  the  new  law  has  taken  effect.
HK's  stock  rout  enters  10th  day,  worst  streak  since  1984. Hong  Kong  stocks  closed  down  175.08  points,  or  0.67  percent,  to  25,976.24  points.

HK's  economy  contracts  8.9%  on  annual  basis,  most  on  record. The  latest  decline  marks  the  third  straight  quarterly  contraction  for  HK,  the  longest  such  stretch  since  the  aftermath  of  the  global  financial  crisis  in  2009.
Leung:  Improved  relations,  rule  changes  streamline  LegCo. Closing  legislative  year,  council  president  praises  Carrie  Lam's  efforts  as  tally  of  bills  passed  more  than  doubles.

Virus:  HK  declares  emergency,  schools  to  be  closed  till  Feb  17. HK  raised  its  response  level  to  the  coronavirus  outbreak  to  "emergency"  and  will  extend  school  holidays  for  non-tertiary  students  to  Feb  17.
Mainland  banks  take  benchmark  to  fresh  record. Market  heavyweight  Tencent  has  led  HSI  upwards  while  the  H-share  index  continues  to  rally  to  close  higher  for  the  18th  day.

JD  seeks  US$4.1  billion  in  year's  biggest  Hong  Kong  listing. JD.com  is  offering  133  million  new  shares  at  as  much  as  HK$236  each,  according  to  terms  of  the  deal  obtained  by  Bloomberg  News.

230  arrested  in  HK  following  Mother’s  Day  protests. The  Mother's  Day  unrest  was  the  first  major  outbreak  of  street  violence  after  4  months  of  relative  quiet  with  the  city  enforcing  curbs  to  contain  COVID-19.
Beijing  gets  a  taste  of  HK’s  intangible  cultural  heritage. First  thematic  exhibition  on  the  SAR’s  traditional  culture  opens  in  capital.
Hong  Kong  stocks  close  0.90%  lower. Hong  Kong  stocks  closed  down  260.51  points,  or  0.90  percent,  to  28,795.91  points.

Full  text  of  HKSAR  govt's  response  to  AmCham  questions. The  response  was  provided  to  assist  the  American  Chamber  of  Commerce  in  understanding  better  HK's  proposed  amendments  to  the  extradition  law.

CE:  Education  best  gift  to  younger  generations. The  Hong  Kong  chief  executive  pledged  the  Hong  Kong  govt  is  committed  to  providing  comprehensive  and  high-quality  education  that  is  available  to  all.

MTRC  looks  to  future  after  new  management  appointments. The  government  has  appointed  Rex  Auyeung  Pak-kuen  to  succeed  Frederick  Ma  Si-hang  as  chairman  of  the  MTR  Corporation  from  July  1.

'Bubbles  in  the  making'  warning  amid  overheated  market. Despite  its  disruptive  power  to  reshape  the  business  world,  the  much-trumpeted  blockchain  technology  should  not  be  overhyped,  warns  an  industry  expert.

MTRC  revenue,  profit  down  for  first  half  of  year. The  city's  rail  operator  said  this  is  mainly  due  to  lackluster  performance  of  its  residential  and  commercial  development  project  in  Shenzhen.

HK  police  seize  12  replica  guns,  arrest  four  in  Yuen  Long. Police  from  the  organized  crime  and  triad  bureau  busted  a  metal-sheet  house  at  about  5:00  pm  Monday,  police  said  in  a  statement  on  Tuesday.

More  HK  executives  keen  to  explore  Bay  Area. Shenzhen,  in  particular,  is  a  magnet  for  these  talents,  according  to  accounting  firm  KPMG’s  latest  annual  Hong  Kong  Executive  Salary  Outlook  survey.

Lam  puts  talent  mobility  in  spotlight. CE  Carrie  Lam  has  made  the  mobility  of  talents  between  Hong  Kong  and  other  Guangdong-Hong  Kong-Macao  Greater  Bay  Area  cities  a  focal  point  in  her  first  year  in  office  as  she  strives  to  involve  the  city  in  the  project.

DAB  encourages  youths  to  tap  into  GBA  opportunities. Party  vowed  to  motivate  more  young  people  to  put  their  heads  together  for  the  development  opportunities  across  the  boundary.
Lam  attends  Central-Wan  Chai  Bypass  commissioning  ceremony. The  Central-Wan  Chai  Bypass  will  be  open  to  traffic  on  Sunday.
HSI  pares  gains  after  record-breaking  run. Benchmark  ends  slightly  lower  following  afternoon  downturn,  ending  lengthy  rally.

Hong  Kong  retail  sales  continue  to  drop  in  Nov  amid  unrest. The  official  data  from  the  HKSAR  govt  shows  the  value  of  total  retail  sales  in  Nov  was  provisionally  estimated  at  HK$30b,  down  23.6%  from  a  year  ago.

Police  officer  interdicted  for  suspected  criminal  damage. The  officer  was  suspected  to  have  damaged  some  documents  at  scene  during  an  anti-crime  patrol  operation  in  Sham  Shui  Po  on  Feb  24.
HK  exchange  tours  to  Bay  Area  increasing. Travel  agency  reports  more  visits  from  SAR  people  attracted  by  region's  successes  in  sci-tech,  innovation  and  education.

HK  govt  confirms  accuracy  of  BGI  lab's  sample  pooling. The  HK  govt  said  there  is  no  evidence  that  the  quality  of  the  testing  services  which  joint  venture  BGI  provides  falls  short  of  established  standards.

Opposition  camp  slammed  for  abetting  violent  behavior. The  opposition  camp  was  strongly  criticized  for  defending  or  even  justifying  the  violence  carried  out  by  radical  protesters  in  the  city's  LegCo  Complex.

HKU  students  call  for  an  end  to  abusive  language  on  campus. A  group  of  students  at  the  University  of  Hong  Kong  condemned  hate  speech  on  campus  and  called  for  an  end  to  the  threat  to  freedom  of  speech.

HK  residents'  responsibilities  in  implementing  Basic  Law  stressed. Tam  Yiu-chung,  a  member  of  the  Basic  Law  Drafting  Committee,  shared  his  views  ahead  of  the  30th  anniversary  of  the  promulgation  of  the  Basic  Law.

Wife  of  HK  man  set  ablaze  'heartbroken  and  speechless'. The  wife  said  her  husband,  who's  still  in  a  coma  at  the  hospital  with  second-degree  burns  on  50%  of  his  body,  still  needs  surgeries  for  his  chest,  abdomen  &  face.

Commissioner  calls  for  end  to  violence,  upholding  rule  of  law. Xie  Feng,  commissioner  of  the  Ministry  of  Foreign  Affairs  of  China  in  the  HKSAR,  issued  the  call  at  a  luncheon  in  Zhuhai  for  foreign  institutions  in  HK  on  Friday.

Legal,  business  heavyweights  back  disqualifying  12  candidates. Various  sectors  in  the  city  supported  the  returning  officers'  decision  to  bar  12  aspiring  candidates  from  standing  for  the  upcoming  LegCo  election.

HK  private  sector  business  activity  hits  30-month  low. The  seasonally  adjusted  Nikkei  Hong  Kong  Purchasing  Managers'  Index  fell  to  47.1  in  November  from  48.6  in  October  --  the  lowest  level  since  June  2016.
25-yr-old  HK's  youngest  patient  as  community  outbreak  feared. According  to  information  shared  by  the  patient,  he  didn't  travel  during  the  incubation  period.
Major  HK  public  services  restored  as  pandemic  abates. As  of  Sunday,  the  city  had  not  seen  a  new  case  of  COVID-19  transmitted  locally  for  14  days  in  a  row.

More  consumers  using  digital  payments  amid  pandemic. Digital  payments  have  been  increasing  during  the  pandemic  because  of  the  ease  with  which  they  allow  people  to  pay  for  goods  and  services.

UK,  Canada  urged  to  stop  meddling  in  HK  affairs. Spokesperson  of  China's  Ministry  of  Foreign  Affairs,  Geng  Shuang,  urged  foreign  countries  to  stop  interfering  in  HK's  extradition  legislation  amendments.

Trade-war  jitters  drive  fresh  round  of  HK  stock  selling. The  benchmark  Hang  Seng  Index  dropped  to  near  the  28,000-point  mark  in  morning  trade  before  afternoon  recovery  moderated  early  losses.
Teachers:  Open  day  shows  respect  for  HK  educators. The  exclusive  event  on  Sunday  will  be  a  catalyst  for  better  communication  with  Chinese  mainland  peers.
HK  retail  sales  up  7.8%  in  July. Retail  sales  grew  visibly  over  a  year  earlier  thanks  to  solid  demand  from  local  consumers  as  well  as  visitors.

China  summons  US  ambassador  over  HK-related  bill. Vice-Foreign  Minister  Zheng  Zeguang    summoned  US  Ambassador  to  China  Terry  Branstad  Monday  to  lodge  stern  representations  and  strong  protest  against  the  US  bill's  passage.

Direct  high-speed  train  service  launched  between  Tianjin,  HK. The  G305  train  departing  Tianjin  at  10:58  am  will  arrive  10  hours  later  at  Hong  Kong  West  Kowloon  Station,  according  to  Tianjin's  railway  authorities.

LegCo  quagmire  condemned  by  HK  political  leaders. Political  heavyweights  have  condemned  opposition  lawmakers  of  failing  to  perform  their  duties  in  public  office  by  paralyzing  the  legislature  for  6  months.
Lawmakers  demand  SAR  govt  block  secessionist  platforms. The  lawmakers  strongly  condemned  the  FCC  for  hosting  a  talk  that  publicly  advocated  separatism.

HK  stocks  enter  bull  market  after  best  quarter  since  '09. The  Hang  Seng  Index  jumped  1.8%,  closing  above  the  29,502.64  level  that  was  required  to  make  the  milestone  official.

HK  urged  to  enact  national  security  law. Political  heavyweights  have  urged  the  govt  to  plug  legal  loopholes  &  minimize  the  threats  to  public  safety  illustrated  in  the  protracted  civil  unrest  last  year.
HK  stocks  tumble  as  market  sentiment  cools. Hong  Kong  stocks  plummeted  as  much  as  585  points  during  intraday  trading,  finishing  at  their  lowest  level  for  the  week.

Lawmakers,  businessmen  decry  organized  violence. Hong  Kong  lawmakers  noted  that  demonstrators  were  incited  to  charge  police  cordons  in  an  insulting  manner,  resulting  in  casualties  and  damage.

In  photos:  Mass  rally  at  Victoria  Park  calls  for  peace. An  estimated  90,000  people  poured  into  Victoria  Park  Saturday  afternoon  to  take  part  in  a  peaceful  rally  to  show  support  to  Hong  Kong  police.
Hong  Kong  stocks  close  0.63%  higher. Hong  Kong  stocks  closed  up  178.99  points,  or  0.63  percent,  to  28,812.17  points.
How  far  can  AI  go  in  reading  the  stock  market?. Asset  managers  may  see  robot  advisers  helping  them  ‘think’  and  ‘do’  with  a  wide    array  of  stocks.

Ho:  Opposition  just  trying  to  find  fault  with  govt. There  was  nothing  at  all  wrong  with  the  HKSAR  government's  plan  to  amend  the  Fugitive  Offenders  Ordinance,  lawmaker  Junius  Ho  Kwan-yiu  said.

Grenville  Cross:  HK  police's  media  rules  'necessary'. Grenville  Cross  voiced  his  support  after  police  said  media  representatives  from  non-registered  local  media  &  journalist  associations  are  no  longer  recognized.

Wuhan  outbreak:  DAB  calls  on  liaison  office  for  coordination. DAB  hoped  the  office  could  ensure  that  Hong  Kong  received  daily  updates  of  developments  related  to  research  into  &  management  of  the  virus,  Starry  Lee  said.
Hong  Kong  stocks  close  1.11%  lower. Hong  Kong  stocks  closed  down  276.83  points,  or  1.11  percent,  to  24,717.63  points.

Analysts:  Cathay  still  faces  bumpy  journey  after  job  cuts. The  airline  said  it  would  axe  8,500  jobs  and  end  its  Cathay  Dragon  brand,  a  decision  Cathay  Pacific  Chairman  Patrick  Healy  described  as  "heart-wrenching".
DAB  condemns  radical  violence  over  weekend. Hong  Kong's  largest  political  party  calls  on  public  and  opposition  parties  to  speak  out  against  attacks  and  support  police.

HK  police  investigate  case  of  12  alleged  fleeing  fugitives. Police  are  probing  whether  someone  had  committed  cross-boundary  crimes  in  a  case  that  involved  12  HK  residents  being  detained  on  the  mainland.

Wang:  HK's  destiny  is  tied  to  merging  with  national  progress. The  key  for  HK  to  achieving  lasting  prosperity  and  stability  is  to  seize  the  opportunities  arising  from  the  nation's  development,  Wang  Zhimin  says.
Hebei,  Hong  Kong  boost  economic  ties. Twenty-four  strategic  business  projects  worth  more  than  US$1.89  billion  were  signed  on  Wednesday.

China,  US  need  to  act  positively,  forum  told. China  &  the  US  have  to  "talk  &  act  positively"  to  address  challenges  &  increase  mutual  understanding,  prominent  scholars  &  officials  said.

HK  opposition  under  fire  over  protests. Education  experts  voiced  concern  that  HK's  young  people  were  being  used  as  political  pawns  by  the  opposition  after    the  unlawful  assemblies  on  Sunday.
Integration  'brings  HK  fresh  opportunities'. Aligning  city's  plans  with  those  of  country  gives  direction  and  makes  way  for  further  expansion.

Full  text:  Speech  by  acting  CE  at  National  Day  reception. Hong  Kong's  acting  CE  Matthew  Cheung  Kin-chung  delivered  a  speech  Tuesday  at  a  National  Day  reception  in  celebration  of  the  PRC's  70th  founding  anniversary.

Land  supply  lift  wins  kudos  from  pundits. Industry  pundits  applauded  the  SAR  government's  ambitious  package  of  proposals  to  address  one  of  the  city's  long-standing  housing  issues.

HK  encouraged  to  engage  in  nation's  further  opening-up. The  central  government's  liaison  office  in  HK  has  pledged  to  extend  full  support  to  the  city  to  contribute  to  the  further  reform  and  opening-up  of  the  nation.
Eric  Chan  named  HK's  national  security  secretary. The  appointment  of  Eric  Chan  Kwok-ki  by  the  State  Council  came  upon  the  nomination  by  Hong  Kong  Chief  Executive  Carrie  Lam.
Hong  Kong  stocks  close  2.00%  lower. The  benchmark  Hang  Seng  Index  traded  between  24,919.95  and  25,576.49.  Turnover  totaled  HK$199.79  billion  (about  US$25.78  billion).

3rd  chartered  flight  brings  home  5  HK  cruise  ship  passengers. Newly  arrived  passengers  will  undergo  a  14-day  quarantine  like  208  other  Hong  Kong  residents  who  arrived  earlier  from  the  cruise  ship  quarantined  Yokohama.
A  tense  night  of  chasing  mob  protesters  in  HK. Compared  with  previous  incidents,  it  appeared  to  me  that  Saturday's  protests  were  more  unscripted,  or  even  aimless.
MTR  resumes  high-speed  rail  trial  run. The  decision  is  made  with  the  consent  of  relevant  government  departments,  according  to  the  rail  operator.

Zhang  spells  out  national  security  legislation  as  urgent  task  for  HK. Establishing  a  sound  legal  system  and  law  enforcement  mechanism  to  safeguard  national  security  has  become  HK's  "major  issue"  and  "urgent  mission".

Hong  Kong  lowers  flags  to  mourn  bus  accident  victims. It  is  the  first  time  the  government  has  flown  the  city's  flags  at  half-mast  since  2012  –  after  a  ferry  collision  off  Lamma  Island  left  39  passengers  dead.

Sources:  NetEase  and  JD.com  set  dates  for  US$5b  HK  listings. The  two  transactions  could  raise  a  combined  US$5  billion  and  the  deals  would  be  the  largest  for  the  HKSAR's
equity  capital  markets  so  far  this  year.

HK  to  benefit  as  nation's  legal  system  develops. To  grasp  opportunities,  Wang  called  for  Hong  Kong  to  continue  to  play  a  leading  role  in  pushing  the  mainland's  market  regulations  to  an  international  level.

EDB  to  start  vetting  private  school  fees  after  watchdog  flak. The  Education  Bureau  said  it  would  start  vetting  refundable  fees  charged  by  private  schools,  which  could  amount  to  a  few  thousand  to  a  few  million  dollars.

2  lawmakers  lose  LegCo  seats  after  final  appeal  quashed. Gary  Fan  Kwok-wai  and  Au  Nok-hin  lost  their  seats  in  the  LegCo  as  the  Court  of  Final  Appeal  rejected  their  appeal  to  challenge  a  verdict  to  disqualify  them.

Ant  'plans  US$17.5  billion  Hong  Kong  IPO,  no  cornerstones'. Ant  Group  is  planning  to  issue  new  stock  equal  to  about  11%  to  15%  of  the  shares  outstanding  and  split  the  float  evenly  between  HK  &  Shanghai,  sources  said.

LegCo  House  Committee,  Finance  Committee  elect  chairs. Starry  Lee  Wai-king  and  Chan  Kiin-por  were  elected  chairpersons  of  the  House  Committee  and  Finance  Committee,  respectively.

HK  sees  single-digit  virus  cases  with  9  infections  reported. The  new  infections  raised  the  city's  tally  of  confirmed  cases  to  4,691,  with  77  deaths,  according  to  the  Centre  for  Health  Protection.

Calm  returns  as  HK  airport  enforces  High  Court  injunction. As  per  court  documents,  the  injunction  would  affect  non-travelers  or  those  without  permission,  prohibiting  them  from  entering  the  departure  hall.

Full  text:  CE's  speech  on  regional  cooperation  at  BRF. CE  Lam  delivered  the  opening  keynote  address  at  the  thematic  forum  on  regional  cooperation  of  the  2nd  Belt  and  Road  forum  in  Beijing  on  Thursday.

China  Daily's  PolyU  coverage  wins  World  Press  Photo  nods. The  video,  "Battleground  Poly  U",  by  multimedia  journalist  DJ  Clark  was  named  best  interactive  visual  experience  and  outstanding  immersive  experience.

World's  largest  electronics  show  to  be  a  big  draw. Global  Sources  will  launch  this  year’s  spring  electronics  fair  at  AsiaWorld-Expo  this  month  by  showcasing  key  technological  achievements.

Study:  HK  has  world’s  highest  rate  of  myopic  kids. Hong  Kong  tops  a  world  ranking  for  6-year-old  children  with  myopia,  after  a  survey  found  that  11.4  percent  —  or  more  than  1  in  10  —  are  nearsighted.

Andy  Chan  among  11  arrested  for  possessing  explosives. Hong  Kong  Police  expressed  concerns  over  escalating  violence  during  anti-extradition-bill  protests,  and  stressed  that  they  won't  tolerate  any  violent  acts.

HK  companies  have  no  safety  net  in  fight  for  survival. The  lack  of  a  proper  legal  framework  for  seeking  bankruptcy  protection  in  HK  means  firms  are  forced  into  liquidation,  according  to  an  industry  expert.

Clare.AI  pioneers  banking  services  powered  by  AI. A  former  investment  banking  official  who  co-founded  an  artificial  intelligence  startup  is  pouring  her  unique  experience  and  perspective  into  a  fledgling  technology  that  helps  banks  better  communicate  with  their  customers.
Cathay  loses  HK$4.5b  as  pandemic  wreaks  havoc  on  air  travel. The  novel  coronavirus  pandemic  has  taken  a  heavy  toll  on  Cathay  Pacific  Airways’  operations.
NPC  deputies  call  for  in-depth  collaboration  over  Bay  Area. HK  and  Macao  cited  for  unique  experience  and  expertise  they  can  offer  to  the  area's  development.

HK  police  launch  probe  into  bus  crash  that  killed  19. Police  arrested  the  bus  driver,  who  is  around  30,  for  dangerous  driving  causing  death,  a  criminal  offense  that  could  land  him  in  jail  for  up  to  10  years.

A  socially  devoted  society  in  the  making. Asia  is  now  seen  as  the  world’s  largest  market  for  impact  investments,  with  the  Chinese  mainland  leading  the  quest  for  big  funding.

Leaders'  tributes  sent  over  death  of  HK  writer. The  central  govt's  top  Hong  Kong  affairs  body,  the  Hong  Kong  and  Macao  Affairs  Office  of  the  State  Council,  expressed  its  condolences  to  Cha's  family.
Hong  Kong  stocks  close  0.47%  higher. Hong  Kong  stocks  closed  up  133.53  points,  or  0.47  percent,  to  28,315.62  points.
HK  stocks  have  best  day  in  over  a  month  on  trade  optimism. The  Hang  Seng  Index  added  2.3  percent  amid  rising  trade  optimism.

Hong  Kong  population  rises  0.2%  to  over  7.5  million. Hong  Kong's  population  has  increased  14,200  to  over  7.5  million  by  the  end  of  2019,  up  0.2  percent  compared  to  one  year  ago.

HK  urges  public  to  deepen  awareness  on  AIDS  prevention. The  HKSAR's  Department  of  Health  launched  a  campaign  to  deepen  public  understanding  and  to  appeal  to  them  to  help  support  people  living  with  HIV.

Chief  engineer  says  bridge  to  'stand  the  test  of  time'. Crediting  50,000  construction  workers  and  engineers  with  an  achievement  he  led,  Su  Quanke  is  pleased  with  the  outcome.
CE  to  lead  HK  delegation  to  attend  BRI  forum. Carrie  Lam  will  deliver  keynote  speeches  on  financial  connectivity  and  regional  cooperation.

China's  ultra  rich  population  seen  to  rise  in  next  5  years. Chinese  mainland's  ultra  rich  population  is    expected  to  grow  by  35  percent  over  the  next  five  years,  according  to  Knight  Frank's  report.

Disastrous  havoc  for  the  innocent. ​Protest  violence  and  chaos  has  been  roiling  HK  for  more  than  6  months.  Even  bystanders  who  seem  to  be  the  furthest  from  the  political  storm  can't  escape  the  vortex.
Business  activity  takes  a  hit  from  prolonged  unrest. Business  activity  takes  a  hit  from  prolonged  unrest  By  Pamela  Lin  in  Hong  KongThe  protracted  social
Hong  Kong  stocks  close  0.15%  higher. Hong  Kong  stocks  closed  up  39.75  points,  or  0.15  percent,  to  25,875.45  points.

CE  Carrie  Lam  vows  to  get  HK  to  a  new  start. Full  text  of  Chief  Executive  Carrie  Lam  Cheng  Yuet-ngor's  speech  at  a  reception  to  celebrate  of  the  22nd  anniversary  of  the  establishment  of  the  HKSAR.

Billionaire  trio  grabs  a  slice  of  Xiaomi's  IPO. China's  richest  people  are  buying  into  Xiaomi's  imminent  HKSAR  initial  public  offering,  conferring  their  imprimatur  on  the  mainland's  smartphone  maker.
Shadow  banking  —  'a  time  bomb  in  the  making'. Experts  warn  of  mortgage  defaults  as  homebuyers  turn  to  money  lenders.
'Trophy  buildings'  lose  shine  as  tenants  pull  out. Vacancy  rates  in  HK's  top-notch  commercial  buildings  are  in  dramatic  upclimb  as  social  turmoil,  trade  row  bite.

Legislators  back  LegCo  president. Forty  lawmakers  issued  a  joint  statement  saying  Legislative  Council  President  Andrew  Leung's  actions  during  co-location  debate  were  fair  and  lawful.

6  positive  cases  indicate  HK  testing  may  uncover  more. The  new  asymptomatic  cases  emerged  after  128,000  people  were  sampled  in  the  first  few  days  of  a  campaign  to  offer  everyone  in  the  city  a  free  test.

CE:  National  security  legislation  to  restore  stability  in  HK. Chief  Executive  Carrie  Lam  stressed  again  that  it  is  the  constitutional  responsibility  of  the  HKSAR  to  safeguard  national  security.

HKSAR  suspends  extradition,  judiciary  assistance  pacts  with  US. The  decision  was  in  response  to  the  US  side's  erroneous  move  of  suspending  or  terminating  three  bilateral  agreements  with  HK,  a  spokesman  said.

HK  lawyer  groups  slam  personal  attacks  on  judge. The  Law  Society  of  Hong  Kong  and  Hong  Kong  Bar  Association  condemned  online  abuse  and  curses  directed  at  judge  who  jailed  Mong  Kok  rioters.

MTRC  makes  HK$2.43b  loss  provisions. MTR  Corp  announced  that  it  will  make  a  provision  of  HK$2  billion  for  costs  arising  from  problems  at  Hung  Hom  Station  of  the  Sha  Tin  to  Central  Link.

Cheung  seeks  cooperation  to  address  socio-economic  issues. The  SAR  government  is  striving  to  improve  the  benefits  to  the  public  in  a  joint  effort  with  cross-spectrum  lawmakers,  said  Matthew  Cheung.
Security  law  to  aid  confidence  in  Hong  Kong. Business  tycoons  in  HK  believed  the  national  security  legislation  would  create  a  more  favorable  business  and  social  environment.

Hong  Kong's  retail  sales  continue  to  slump  in  April. HK  retail  sales  continued  to  decline  in  April  due  to  the  pandemic  and  violent  incidents  since  last  year,  with  sales  in  department  stores  dropping  18  percent.

Li  stresses  HK's  integration  with  national  economy. Premier  Li  Keqiang  on  Monday  pledged  that  the  central  government  will  continue  to  implement  the  'one  country,  two  systems'  principle  in  the  Hong  Kong  and  Macao.
CE  condemns  separatism  talks  on  campus. Carrie  Lam  expresses  concern  about  'extremely  inappropriate  remarks'  by  student  union  leaders

Vice-premier  urges  HK  to  halt  violence. Vice-Premier  Han  Zheng  on  Wednesday  said  ending  the  nearly  five-month  long  violence  remains  the  SAR  govt's  top  priority  and  accountability.

Tong  blames  foreign  meddling  for  growing  extradition  row. ​Executive  Councilor  and  barrister  Ronny  Tong  Ka-wah  also  criticized  the  behavior  of  opposition  legislators  for  exacerbating  the  situation.

CE:  HK's  judicial  independence  remains  intact. HK's  political  system,  its  constitutional  order  as  well  as  its  judicial  independence  are  free  from  any  interference,  Chief  Executive  Carrie  Lam  said.

Maria  Tam:  Societies  Ordinance  right  weapon  to  fight  separatist  groups. HKSAR  Basic  Law  Committee's  deputy  director  supports  the  govt's  move  to  ban  the  Hong  Kong  National  Party  which  advocates  "independence"  from  China.

CE:  HK  making  steady  progress  in  realizing  GBA  vision. Carrie  Lam  shared  how  steady  progress  had  been  made  in  terms  of  policy  implementation  since  the  GBA  Outline  Development  Plan  was  unveiled  in  Feb.

Love  HK  and  stop  hurting  it,  say  ordinary  HK  people. As  protracted  violence  continue  to  roil  Hong  Kong,  ordinary  Hong  Kong  people  find  themselves  bearing  the  brunt  of  the  burden.
Hong  Kong  stocks  strike  10-day  rising  streak. At  close  of  trade,  the  Hang  Seng  index  was  up  84.89  points  or  0.28  percent  at  30,899.53.

More  than  500  arrested  in  Lunar  New  Year  anti-smuggling  raids. A  total  of  655  cases  were  detected  during  the  19-day  operation  against  cross-boundary  smuggling  activities  before  and  during  the  Lunar  New  Year.

HK  tightens  rules  after  8th  death,  52  new  COVID-19  cases. The  HKSAR  govt  brought  back  a  slew  of  restrictive  measures  Monday  after  the  city  recorded  52  new  cases,  including  41  that  were  locally  transmitted.

HK  government  provides  30,000  masks  for  private  clinics. At  least  10  private  clinics  have  been  forced  to  closed  while  others  have  shortened  opening  hours  due  to  the  shortage  of  face  masks.

LegCo  chief  recalls  'roller  coaster'  4  years  at  helm. Legislative  Council  President  Andrew  Leung  Kwan-yuen  describes  the  past  four  years  at  the  helm  of  Hong  Kong’s  legislature  as  "a  roller  coaster  ride".

HK  students  land  internships  at  nuclear  firm. Four  students  from  the  City  University  of  Hong  Kong  will  begin  their  internships  at  China's  major  nuclear  power  operator,  China  General  Nuclear  Power  Corp.
The  virus  keeps  forensic  auditors  on  their  toes. Travel  restrictions  have  made  it  almost  impossible  for  auditors  to  go  to  the  mainland  to  carry  out  on-site  auditing  work.

Property  firm:  HK  home  prices  face  at  least  15%  drop  in  2019. Property  firm  Jones  Lang  LaSalle  Inc  urges  government  to  drop  extra  stamp  duties  to  help  prevent  a  market  stall.
Online  sales  shine  as  pent-up  demand  fueled. Retailers  aggressively  promote  discounts  online  amid  signs  of  economic  recovery.

AR  book  a  new  guide  to  Hong  Kong. HKSAR  tourism  officials  are  tapping  into  the  application  of  augmented  reality  technology  to  attract  young  people  from  the  mainland  to  visit  the  city.

HK  judiciary  needs  to  ‘break  personal  agenda’. A  retired  HK  judge  said  the  city's  judiciary  needs  soul-searching  as  the  courts  helped  create  the  environment  leading  to  the  mayhem  last  year.

Security  chief:  Radicals  creating  atmosphere  of  'black  terror'. Secretary  for  Security  John  Lee  Ka-chiu  told  reporters  that  over  the  past  two  days,  radical  protesters  had  wreaked  havoc  to  undermine  HK's  rule  of  law.

HK  tycoon  warns  of  rising  complexity  in  global  economy. Li  Ka-shing  warned  citizens  against  speculation  in  property  market  as  property  prices  might  fluctuate  remarkably  in  2019.
Smart  robot  to  join  the  war  against  coronavirus. Local  startup  Roborn  Technology  has  developed  a  smart  robot  with  5G  technology  to  monitor  body  temperatures  in  public  places.

US  bill  on  HKSAR  condemned. ​​The  Foreign  Affairs  Committee  of  the  NPC  said  the  passage  of  the  so-called  "Hong  Kong  Autonomy  Act"  was  a  serious  violation  of  international  law.

HK  stocks  ends  bumpy  year  with  9.1  percent  gain. 2019  was  a  roller  coaster  year  for  HK's  equity  market  which  was  depressed  over  worries  about  local  social  unrest,  Sino-US  trade  dispute,  global  economic  concerns.

Maria  Tam:  HK  right  to  pass  extradition  bill. The  deputy  director  of  the  Basic  Law  Committee  said  the  bill  would  help  handle  the  Taiwan  murder  case  and  plug  legal  loopholes  at  the  same  time.

Leung's    jail  term    reasonable:  Prosecutor. HK's  top  public  prosecutor  said  on  Wednesday  the  heavy  punishment  handed  down  to  HK  independence  activist  Edward  Leung  Tin-kei  was  fair.

HK's  national  security  committee  convenes  first  meeting. All  the  members  of  the  committee  attended  the  meeting,  including  its  chair,  HKSAR  Chief  Executive  Carrie  Lam  Cheng  Yuet-ngor.
HKUST  student  union  called  out  for  'Chinese  pneumonia'  remarks. Backlash  from  alumni  and  fellow  students  who  say  the  union  does  not  speak  for  the  university.

Experts:  National  security  law  to  boost  good  governance  in  HK. Jurists  attending  a  symposium  held  by  China  Law  Society  said  the  new  law  has  offered  a  strong  legal  guarantee  for  the  SAR's  long-term  prosperity  and  stability.

730  sets  of  traffic  lights  damaged  in  HK  due  to  violence. Traffic  lights  were  more  seriously  vandalized  in  October  and  November  as  a  number  of  controllers  were  burnt  and  many  cables  have  to  be  replaced.

Hong  Kong  govt  officials  donate  HK$10.8m  to  fight  epidemic. Major  government  officials  in  HK  have  donated  one  month's  remuneration  amounting  to  more  than  HK$10.8  million  to  the  Community  Chest  of  Hong  Kong.

HK:  University  Station  reopens  after  month-long  repair. The  station  reopened  on  Saturday  after  month-long  repair  work  but  some  areas  and  facilities  remained  shut  for  ongoing  repair  works.
HK  ‘bracing  for  a  hit’  as  trade  tensions  linger. Broad  spectrum  of  businesses  will  suffer  from  US-China  spat,  stalled  economies,  pundits  warn.

HK  remains  most  expensive  office  market  in  the  world. This  is  the  third  year  in  a  row  that  HK's  Central  district  has  outstripped  its  peers  in  the  survey  conducted  by  CBRE  Group  Inc  of  prime  office  real  estate.

RTHK  warned  after  controversial  show  drew  flak. Board  of  Advisors  Chairman  Eugene  Chan  Kin-keung  has  asked  RTHK  shows  to  abide  by  the  public  broadcaster's  charter,  which  requires  accurate  and  impartial  news  and  information.

HK  to  ease  post-Fukushima  food  import  ban  Tuesday. Imports  of  vegetables,  fruits,  milk,  milk  beverages  and  dried  milk  from  four  Japanese  prefectures  will  be  allowed  starting  from  next  Tuesday.

HKSAR  govt  refutes  Trump's  claim,  says  sanction  unjustified. The  HKSAR  government  has  refuted  a  claim  by  US  President  Donald  Trump  that  the  financial  hub  now  operated  under  "one  country,  one  system".
Railway  stations  boast  improved  services,  facilities. Major  upgrades  have  been  completed  at  high-speed  railway  stations  in  Shenzhen  and  Guangzhou.
HK  bill  may  hand  tax  exemptions  to  local  hedge  funds. HK  has  proposed  widening  tax  breaks  to  include  hedge  and  private  equity  funds  that  are  domiciled  in  the  city.
Walking  tall  in  a  technology  world. Examine  how  technologies  are  disrupting  customer  behaviors  in  seeking  loans,  trading  securities  or  making  insurance  claims.

Yum  China  'targets  September'  for  Hong  Kong  listing. Yum  China  operates  10,000  restaurants  in  over  1,400  cities  across  the  mainland,  according  to  its  website.  Its  New  York  shares  have  risen  13  percent  this  year.

Prudential  signs  US$753m  Thai  deal  with  tycoon  Li's  FWD. Prudential's  Thai  unit  will  buy  the  exclusive  rights  from  FWD  to  sell  life  insurance  products  via  TMB  Bank,  the  Thai  lender  said  in  an  exchange  filing.

Authorities  vow  to  defend  stability  as  HK  stocks  fluctuate. Hong  Kong's  stock  and  derivatives  markets  still  performed  normally  and  the  banking  sector  also  remained  stable,  HK's  Financial  Secretary  Paul  Chan  said.

HKMAO  expresses  condolences  on  passing  of  Louis  Cha. The  Hong  Kong  and  Macao  Affairs  Office  of  the  State  Council  praised  the  writer  for  his  popular  literary  work  and  also  his  support  for  Hong  Kong  and  the  nation.

HK  health  chief:  COVID-19  situation  has  'stabilized'. Food  and  Health  Secretary  Sophia  Chan  said  the  pandemic  in  HK  has  stabilized,  but  it  is  difficult  to  know  when  the  city  will  see  no  confirmed  cases  again.

HK  bars,  pubs  to  shut  for  14  days  as  city  sees  37  new  infections. HK  further  tightens  social  distancing  as  the  city  reported  37  new  cases  on  Thursday,  including  a  bar  worker  who  visited  several  bars  during  the  incubation  period.

HK  financial  system  remains  resilient,  finance  chief  says. Stress  tests  indicate  even  in  extremely  adverse  situations,  banks,  intermediaries  in  securities  sector  and  insurers  can  still    meet  regulatory  requirements,  Lau  said.

HK  ramps  up  pneumonia  prevention  ahead  of  holiday. The  Hong  Kong  government  has  stepped  up  precautions  against  the  Wuhan  pneumonia  ahead  of  the  peak  travel  season  of  the  Chinese  New  Year.

Anti-dengue  effort  pledged  despite  no  new  cases  reported. There  have  been  no  new  local  dengue  fever  cases  reported  in  the  past  two  days,  according  to  a  government  press  release  Tuesday.
Hong  Kong  stocks  close  0.94%  higher. The  benchmark  Hang  Seng  Index  traded  between  24,194.41  and  24,456.97.  Turnover  totaled  HK$113.01  billion  (about  US$14.58  billion).

Hong  Kong  reports  four  new  coronavirus  cases,  all  imported. The  new  cases  included  a  31-year-old  man  from  France,  a  45-year-old  woman  from  Canada,  and  a  34-year-old  woman  and  a  39-year-old  man  from  India.

Bridge  signals  boom  for  Greater  Bay  Area. Engineer  Yu  Lie  has  spent  more  than  30  years  working  on  bridges  and  if  there's  one  that  he  is  proud  of,  that  would  be  the  HK-Zhuhai-Macao  Bridge.

National  knowledge  quiz  draws  record  no.  of  HK  contestants. More  than  5,000  students  from  160  schools  and  universities  participated  in  the  9th  Hong  Kong  National  Knowledge  Contest  –  the  city's  largest  such  events.
Hong  Kong  stocks  close  0.29%  higher. Hong  Kong  stocks  closed  up  78.40  points,  or  0.29  percent,  to  27,260.44  points.

CE  says  judicial  independence  upheld  in  Hong  Kong. Carrie  Lam  was  responding  to  claims  that  judicial  means  were  used  to  carry  out  political  prosecution  in  the  court  ruling  on  the  Occupy  Central  case.
Hebei,  Hong  Kong  boost  economic  ties. Twenty-four  strategic  business  projects  worth  more  than  US$1.89  billion  were  signed  on  Wednesday.
Commissioner  values  front-line  communication. Chris  Tang  Ping-keung  plans  to  bring  Asia's  finest  back  to  its  former  glory.
Rebecca  Chan  Hoi-yan  wins  Kowloon  West  LegCo  seat. Rebecca  Chan  Hoi-yan  polled  106,457  votes  to  win  the  Kowloon  West  Legislative  Council  by-election  on  Nov  25,  2018.

Bankers  return  to  work  in  Asia  as  London,  NY  remain  wary. In  HK,  Citigroup  is  planning  to  install  plastic  partitions  in  work  stations  while  Morgan  Stanley  has  recalibrated  the  elevator  in  its  skyscraper  for  faster  rides.
HKEx  appoints  Laura  Cha  to  chair. Attracting  listings  and  cooperation  with  mainland  bourses  are  the  key  goals  for  the  first  woman  to  head  the  exchange  operator’s  board.
HK  sees  new  high  in  virus  cases. Hong  Kong  hit  a  record  single-day  high  of  145  new  coronavirus  cases  on  Monday,  bringing  the  city’s  total  to  2,778.

HK  poised  to  keep  IPO  crown  for  second  consecutive  year. Deloitte  said  that  fundraising  on  the  HKSAR  bourse  this  year  is  projected  to  see  a  year-on-year  increase  of  8.35  percent  to  HK$311.8  billion.

HK  govt  condemns  calls  for  strike,  class  boycott. The  government  condemned  the  call  for  holding  a  strike  and  class  boycott  as  a  referendum  to  oppose  the  proposed  national  security  law  in  Hong  Kong.

Hong  Kong  stocks  end  weaker  ahead  of  trade  talk  outcome. At  the  close  of  trade,  the  Hang  Seng  index  was  down  0.2  percent  at  28,432.05  points,  while  Hang  Seng  China  Enterprises  index  closed  0.3  percent  lower.

No  distance  in  common  fight. HK  residents  from  Hubei  played  a  big  role  in  helping  the  province  overcome  the  virus  crisis,  facilitating  the  donation  of  US$14m  in  funds  &  supplies.
Protester  jailed  for  5  weeks  for  burning  national  flag. The  apprentice  barista  was  originally  sentenced  to  240  hours  of  community  service  for  burning  the  national  flag​.

Hoteliers  unable  to  see  light  at  the  end  of  the  tunnel. As  inbound  tourism  continues  to  bear  the  brunt  of  COVID-19,  HK  hoteliers  remain  pessimistic  about  what  the  market  holds  in  the  first  half  of  this  year.
HK  shares  fall  after  Trump  hints  he  may  postpone  trade  deal. Hang  Seng  Index  ended  the  day  lower  328.74  points,  or  1.25  percent.
China  Tower  seeks  to  raise  up  to  US$8.7b  in  HK  IPO. China  Tower  is  pursuing  the  world's  biggest  IPO  in  almost  four  years  amid  a  slump  in  the  Hong  Kong  equity  market.
HKSAR-Macao  tax  arrangement  takes  effect. A  HK  government  spokesman  said  the  arrangement  to  avoid  double  taxation  would  help  promote  bilateral  trade  and  investment  activities.

ByteDance's  chief  rival  files  for  US$5  billion  Hong  Kong  IPO. Kuaishou  reported  revenue  climbed  48%  to  US$3.8  billion  in  2020's  first  half,  underlining  the  scorching  pace  of  growth  of  a  Chinese  short  video  market.

Hong  Kong  residents'  income  down  7.5%. HK's  GNI,  the  total  income  earned  by  HK  residents  from  engaging  in  economic  activities,  stood  at  HK$698.7  billion  in  the  2nd  quarter,  according  to  govt  data.

Liaison  chief:  HK  must  uphold  Basic  Law  despite  challenges. Luo  Huining  has  called  on  Hong  Kong  compatriots  to  stay  committed  to  the  principle  of  "one  country,  two  systems"  in  spite  of  difficulties.

HKSAR  govt  slams  radicals  after  renewed  violence  wreaks  havoc. A  spokesperson  for  the  HKSAR  govt  expressed  extreme  indignation  at  the  repeated  attacks  by  masked  radicals  who  went  on  a  rampage  again.
Teachers  urged  to  stick  to  facts  on  HK  governance  system. Hong  Kong  education  experts  said  education  workers  should  uphold  their  professionalism  and  stick  to  the  facts.
Hong  Kong  stocks  close  0.87%  higher. Hong  Kong  stocks  closed  up  239.78  points,  or  0.87  percent,  to  27,823.66  points.

Govt  mails  meds  to  nearly  3,000  stranded  on  the  mainland. More  than  2,600  Hong  Kong  residents  in  Guangong  and  Fujian  provinces,  as  well  as  some  200  in  Hubei  province,  have  received  medications  for  illnesses.

HK  pledges  US$10m  to  AIIB  special  fund. The  commitment  was  made  during  Chief  Executive  Carrie  Lam  Cheng  Yuet-ngor  meeting  with  Jin  Liqun,  president  of  AIIB  in  Beijing  on  Thursday.

Civic  leaders  applaud  the  new  security  office. Civic  leaders  said  the  national  security  office​  set  up  in  HK  by  the  central  govt  will  fortify  the  city’s  defense  against  threats  to  national  security.

HKMAO  affirms  strong  support  for  HK  police. Yang  Guang,  spokesperson  for  the  Hong  Kong  and  Macao  Affairs  Office  of  the  State  Council,  applauds  the  performance  of  the  city's  law  enforcers.

Postponing  LegCo  election  'right  decision'. It  is  every  government’s  sacred  duty  to  protect  its  people’s  lives,  said  Witman  Hung,  a  Hong  Kong  deputy  to  the  National  People's  Congress.

Youths  show  love  for  HK,  back  rule  of  law  at  music  assembly. Singers  were  invited  to  perform  at  the  Icon  Music  Assembly  in  Mong  Kok,  and  representatives  expressed  hope  for  an  orderly  and  harmonious  society.
Hong  Kong  stocks  open  0.09%  higher. Hong  Kong  stocks  gained  26.30  points,  or  0.09  percent,  to  open  at  27,935.42  points  on  Friday.
Shek  defends  men's  vault  title  at  Asiad. Shek  Wai-hung  brought  home  the  first  ever  gymnastics  gold  at  Asiad  for  Hong  Kong,  China  at  the  2014  Incheon  Asian  Games.

Ant  Group  delivers  timely  boost  to  Hong  Kong  listing  market. Ant  Group's  planned  sale  of  up  to  US$30  billion  worth  of  shares  is  set  to  revive  fortunes  for  Hong  Kong  Exchanges  and  Clearing  Ltd.

HKU  scientists  invent  drug  for  HIV-1  prevention. BiIA-SG  will  hopefully  be  the  first  "made  in  Hong  Kong"  anti-HIV-1  antibody  drug  for  clinical  development,  the  HKU  research  team  said.

Bay  Area  cultural  links  promoted. ​Cross-border  cultural  ties  will  open  a  bigger  market  for  HK  and  Macao  culture-related  businesses  and  help  ease  disharmony  in  HK,  officials  said.

HK  businesses  suffering  but  will  rebound,  says  commerce  body  head. Aron  Harilela,  chairman  of  the  Hong  Kong  General  Chamber  of  Commerce,  expressed  his  views  during  an  exclusive  interview  with  China  Daily.
HK  'can  be  Bay  Area's  global  tourism  hub'. The  Belt  &  Road  International  Tourism  Forum  on  New  Business  Opportunities  was  held  in  Hong  Kong  on  Thursday.

HK-Zhuhai-Macao  Bridge  shortlisted  for  structural  awards. ​Several  other  Chinese  structures  have  also  been  shortlisted  for  the  2019  Structural  Awards  organized  by  the  UK-based  Institute  of  Structural  Engineer.

Liaison  Office  condemns  defamation  over  property  purchase. The  central  government's  Liaison  Office  in  HKSAR  stressed  that  it  bought  and  used  the  properties  strictly  in  accordance  with  the  law.
HK  court  rejects  appeal  of  disqualified  lawmaker. Leung  Kwok-hung  has  the  option  of  moving  the  Court  of  Final  Appeal,  the  city's  top  court,  to  challenge  the  ruling.

Producers  of  equipment  in  PRD  shine. Experts  say  the  Greater  Bay  Area  funnels  investments  into  cities  on  the  west  bank  of  the  Pearl  River  Delta  for  projects  in  advanced  equipment  manufacturing.

Tencent  smashes  record  high  after  stock's  US$307b  rebound. The  internet  and  gaming  giant  rose  4.9  percent  to  a  record  HK$497.40  on  Tuesday,  leapfrogging  Alibaba  as  Asia's  most  valuable  company.

AB  InBev  said  to  target  US$5b  in  Asian  unit's  HK  IPO  this  month. At  US$5  billion,  the  AB  InBev  Asia's  share  sale  would  be  the  world's  second  largest  this  year,  trailing  Uber's  US$8.1  billion  US  IPO  in  May.

HK  police  arrest  336  over  protests  during  Christmas. Chief  police  spokesman  Kwok  Ka-chuen  said  those  detained  between  Monday  and  Thursday  included  92  women  and  minors  as  young  as  12.

Hang  Seng  index  closes  0.8%  higher. The  Hang  Seng  index  ended  0.8  percent  higher  at  29,696.17,  while  the  China  Enterprises  Index  closed  0.1  percent  higher  at  11,505.74  points.

CE:  No  one  is  above  the  law,  including  lawmakers. Chief  Executive  Carrie  Lam  said  any  Department  of  Justice  prosecution  will  based  on  the  law,  and  will  not  be  affected  by  any  political  interference.

Hospital  Authority  chief  to  seek  more  govt  support  for  staff. Henry  Fan  said  he  would  ask  the  government  for  additional  support  to  frontline  staff  who  remain  in  their  posts  amid  a  strike  by  some  5,000  staff.

LegCo  chief:  Yangtze  River  Delta  sheds  light  on  HK's  role  in  Bay  Area. Legislative  Council  President  Andrew  Leung  Kwan-yuen  said  the  Yangtze  River  Delta  is  one  of  the  nation's  most  affluent  areas  and  economic  powerhouses.
HKSAR  government:  Respect  constitutional  order. Spokesman  condemns  calls  for  foreign  intervention  in  city’s  affairs  after  violent  protests  on  Sunday.

HK  sees  9  new  COVID-19  cases,  tally  at  1,242. The  new  cases  involved  three  males  and  six  females  aged  between  two  and  40.  All  patients  had  a  travel  history  during  the  incubation  period.

Police  chief  confident  order  will  restore  in  HK. Lo  Wai-chung  made  the  remarks  during  the  Force  Remembrance  Day  to  commemorate  those  who  have  sacrificed  themselves  in  service  on  Friday.

External  interference  in  national  security  legislation  opposed. The  United  Front  Supporting  National  Security  Legislation  launched  a  petition,  which  was  signed  by  more  than  1m  people  as  of  Tuesday  evening.

​Higher  level  mechanism  to  coordinate  Bay  Area  development. The  new  mechanism  will  also  involve  the  National  Development  and  Reform  Commission  and  the  Hong  Kong  and  Macau  Affairs  Office,  a  HK  official  said.
Gene  scientists  debate  ethics  of  experiment. Chinese  researcher's  alteration  of  human  cells  widely  condemned.

Report:  Recurrent  cash  policies  lift  382,200  out  of  poverty. The  pre-intervention  poverty  figures  in  2018  rose  slightly  year-on-year,  with  a  poor  population  of  more  than  1.4  million  people,  said  the  government.
2  lawmakers  held  over  riot. Police  believe  some  of  the  other  11  detained  suspects  are  triad  members.

Hong  Kong  stocks  mark  3-week  closing  low,  energy  shares  fall. The  Hang  Seng  Index  ended  Thursday  weaker,  losing  467.39  points  or  1.73%  to  26,623.87,  the  lowest  close  since  Sept  12.

Greater  Bay  Area  conference  held  in  Hong  Kong. The  5th  Greater  Bay  Area  conference  themed  "Inclusive  Growth  through  Innovation  and  Sustainability"  is  being  held  in  Hong  Kong  on  Thursday.

HK  retains  top  spot  for  luxury  homes  in  Asia. Luxury-home  prices  in  Hong  Kong  remained  the  second-highest  worldwide  for  the  sixth  consecutive  year  last  year,  according  to  Knight  Frank.

Bomb  threat  at  public  toilet  at  Shenzhen  Bay  Port. The  incident  happened  after  a  bomb  went  off  at  a  hospital  in  HK  Monday,  and  a  public  toilet  in  Kowloon  was  set  ablaze  in  a  suspected  bombing  Monday  night.

HK  students  told  to  stay  put  if  they  develop  symptoms  overseas. Health  authorities  advise  students  to  seek  medical  attention  where  they  get  symptoms,  as  throngs  of  returnees  further  strain  city's  medical  system.

HK  bourse  is  said  to  mull  new  market-maker  rules. Hong  Kong  Exchanges  &  Clearing  Ltd.  is  looking  at  ways  to  ease  rules  that  require  market  makers  to  have  a  physical  presence  in  HK  and  be  regulated.

Veteran  politician  Lau  Nai-keung  dies  at  71. Lau,  who  was  involved  in  politics  and  business,  was  also  a  regular  columnist  for  China  Daily.  He  died  from  cancer,  according  to  sources.

One  Country,  Two  Systems  alive  and  well  in  Hong  Kong,  says  former  CE  Leung. Contrary  to  what  Western  media  and  politicians  are  reporting,  the  National  Security  Law  for  Hong  Kong  does  not  “terminate”  the  “one  country,  two  systems”  principle,  said  Hong  Kong  former  chief  executive  Leung  Chun-ying.
Govt  proposes  HK$50  per  household  to  ease  power  inflation. Payout  to  electricity  users  proposed  as  mandatory  switch  from  coal  to  gas  generation  drives  increase  in  tariffs.

New  policy  to  spur  rise  of  strategic  bay  area. The  new  region  is  expected  to  play  a  more  significant  role  in  the  global  economy  through  integrating  advantages  in  the  region.
Expert  assures  adequate  water  supply  in  HK. Concern  arises  as  the  city  saw  a  rainfall  of  only  one-fifth  of  the  average  at  57  millimeters  in  May.

Disciplined  Services  volunteers  join  fight  against  COVID-19. Current  and  retired  officers  of  the  city's  different  disciplined  branches  volunteer  to  help  with  the  fight  against  the  novel  coronavirus.

HK  govt  proposes  to  raise  virus  relief  outlay  to  HK$30  billion. The  proposal  comes  on  a  day  the  SAR  govt  announced  to  extend  the  work-from-home  arrangement  for  civil  servants  to  March  1.

Pearl  River  Delta  trailblazer  charts  new  path  in  Bay  Area. Pansy  Ho  Chiu-king  set  her  sights  on  South  China’s  Pearl  River  Delta  as  early  as  12  years  ago  —  more  than  a  decade  before  the  idea  of  the  Guangdong-Hong  Kong-Macao  Greater  Bay  Area  came  along.

HKSAR  govt:  No  unauthorized  dock  entry. The  Central  Military  Dock  has  become  a  "protected  place,"  the  SAR  government  said,  advising  people  not  to  enter  the  area  dock  without  authorization.

HSBC  offers  US$3.9b  liquidity  relief  to  Hong  Kong  firms. Banks  across  the  city  are  considering  loan  relief  to  help  struggling  customers  and  businesses  as  the  outbreak  crimps  spending  and  travel.
Swire  &  Sons  director  appointed  as  Cathay  Pacific  chairman. Patrick  Healy's  appointment  and  election  will  take  effect  at  the  board  meeting  of  Cathay  Pacific  on  Nov  6.

Cheung:  New  civil  recruits  must  take  Basic  Law  pledge. Matthew  Cheung  said  in  his  blog  that  it  is  the  consistent  duty  of  civil  servants  to  uphold  the  HKSAR  Basic  Law  and  be  loyal  to  the  HKSAR  and  its  government.
Hong  Kong  stocks  close  0.30%  lower. Hong  Kong  stocks  closed  down  83.72  points,  or  0.30  percent,  to  27,800.49  points.
CE  meets  Scottish  First  Minister. Carrie  Lam  said  Hong  Kong  and  Scotland  are  partners  in  various  aspects,  in  particular  in  innovation  and  technology.

HK  Exchange  Fund  posts  the  second-highest  annual  return. HK's  investment  income  in  2019  registered  HK$247.2  billion,  the  second-highest  in  fund's  history,  while  expert  cautions  of  uncertainties  this  year.

Visitor  arrivals  to  HK  down  30%  during  New  Year  holiday. Visitor  arrivals  to  HK  tumbled  nearly  30%  year-on-year  in  the  New  Year  holiday,  as  six  months  of  social  unrest  in  the  city    continues  to  deter  tourists.

Hong  Kong  to  lead  in  mediation  services. Mediation  services  are  becoming  more  important  in  an  increasingly  globalized  economy  –  and  it's  an  area  where  Hong  Kong  hopes  to  fill  the  gap.

Microbiologist  says  priority  is  to  sever  transmission  chain. Yuen  Kwok-yung,  the  University  of  Hong  Kong  microbiology  professor,  mentioned  that  there  is  no  need  for  Hong  Kong  to  ban  trading  and  shut  down  the  SAR.
One  day  in  Tibet,  two  New  Year's  celebrations. People  in  the  Tibet  autonomous  region  have  geared  up  for  the  final  preparations  of  the  Tibetan  New  Year.
New  extradition  law  will  'safeguard  HK's  stability'. Hong  Kong  deputies  and  policy  advisers  rally  behind  the  govt  over  its  proposed  amendment  to  the  city's  extradition  laws.

Research  policy  overhaul  ‘boosts  prospects  for  city,  nation’. A  leading  Chinese  medicine  researcher  sees  synergies  in  HK’s  global  reach  complementing  the  mainland’s  natural  resources  and  talent  pool.

Star  entrepreneurs  vow  to  help  peers  in  Bay  Area. Young  entrepreneurs  in  Hong  Kong  pledged  on  Thursday  to  play  a  greater  role  in  inspiring  and  helping  their  peers  in  the  Greater  Bay  Area.

HK  Disneyland  prepares  for  reopening  as  infections  dwindle. The  Hong  Kong  Disneyland  Resort  is  preparing  to  reopen  in  light  of  the  improving  pandemic  situation  in  Hong  Kong,  the  theme  park  told  Xinhua.

Pandemic  impact  to  be  'more  evident'  in  coming  months. HK  enterprises  should  expect  the  adverse  impact  of  the  pandemic  to  become  more  evident  in  the  coming  months,  Richard  Li  Tzar-kai  has  warned.

HK  services  sector  to  get  more  access  to  mainland. Chan  Mo-po  said  the  amendment  agreement  showed  the  mainland  and  HK  are  determined  to  propel  open  markets  amid  protectionism  around  the  globe.

Movie  on  Xinjiang  children  impresses  at  HK  film  festival. A  First  Farewell,  a  documentary-style  movie  about  the  lives  of  children  from  Xinjiang  Uygur  autonomous  region  was  well  received  at  HKIFF.

HK  police  sound  alarm  over  protesters'  homemade  explosives. Police  provided  a  rare  behind-the-scenes  look  Friday  at  its  bomb  disposal  squad  to  show  the  potentially  deadly  destructive  force  of  such  explosives.

Wang:  Extradition  bill  in  line  with  Basic  Law. The  extradition  law  amendments  proposed  by  the  Hong  Kong  SAR  govt  are  in  line  with  the  Basic  Law,  the  central  government's  liaison  office  said.
Ending  violence,  restoring  order  HK's  priorities. What  remains  following  the  monthslong  unrest  is  a  polarized  society,  a  battered  economy,  and  growing  uncertainty.

Mainland  traders  sell  record  HK  stocks  as  Tencent  stings. Mainland  investors  sold  net  HK$25.4  billion  (US$3.2  billion)  of  HK  equities  in  August  through  Tuesday,  according  to  Bloomberg  calculations.

Civil  servants  association  opposes  strike. HK  Chinese  Civil  Servants’  Association  voiced  its  opposition  to  strikes  and  rallies  organized  in  name  of  the  city's  civil  servants  for  any  political  purpose.

Liaison  Office  opens  its  door  to  all  HK  lawmakers. The  Liaison  Office  has  invited  all  legislators  and  the  LegCo  head  to  attend  a  spring  reception  at  its  complex  on  Feb  19,  according  to  an  invitation  letter.

Hong  Kong  IPO  market  shows  revival  signs  amid  protests. A  mild  recovery  in  Hong  Kong  share  prices  is  giving  firms  confidence  to  venture  back  while  positive  post-IPO  performances  are  helping  to  bolster  investor  interest.
Central  leaders  urge  recognition  of  SARs'  input  in  joint  projects. HK,  Macao  affairs  director  emphasizes  livelihood  betterment  as  key  goal  in  planning  two  cities'  development

Business  leaders  hail  opening-up  a  'win-win'  for  mainland,  SAR. Leaders  hailed  the  Hong  Kong  SAR's  role  in  linking  the  Chinese  mainland  with  the  global  market  as  a  continuation  of  the  reform  and  opening-up.

HSI  seen  to  settle  around  27,140  by  end  of  2019. Hong  Kong's  equity  benchmark  Hang  Seng  Index  is  expected  to  fluctuate  between  27,000  and  29,000  points  in  the  second  half  of  2019,  according  to  DBS.
HK  unveils  up  to  HK$137.5  billion  in  new  relief  package. Hong  Kong  Chief  Executive  Carrie  Lam  said  that  HK$80  billion  will  be  allocated  to  saving  jobs.

'Occupy'  verdict  offers  vital    lesson  for  HK  young  people. The  conviction  of  the  nine  ringleaders  showed  young  people  that  the  rule  of  law  must  be  respected,  Hong  Kong's  politicians  and  professionals  said.

Competitiveness:  HK  ranked  3rd  as  Singapore  takes  top  spot. The  report's  index  maps  out  the  competitive  landscape  of  141  economies  based  on  more  than  100  indicators  in  a  dozen  categories.

7  Hong  Kong  Airlines  planes  seized  after  missed  payments. Under  the  Airport  Authority  Ordinance,  HK's  Airport  Authority  is  allowed  to  sell  the  planes  if  overdue  charges  are  not  repaid  within  60  days  of  the  detention.

Lam:  Bay  Area's  fortunes  depend  on  innovation,  connection. Success  for  the  Bay  Area  project  will  depend  on  innovation  and  connection,  Carrie  Lam  said  when  meeting  Guangdong  Party  chief  Li  Xi.

HK  government  launches  public  consultation  on  Policy  Address. Carrie  Lam  has  invited  members  of  the  public  to  give  their  views  on  the  2019  Policy  Address  through  the  internet,  by  phone  or  by  fax.

CE  urges  scrutiny  of  fugitive  law  revision. CE  Carrie  Lam  urged  pan-democratic  lawmakers  to  fulfill  their  duty  as  legislators  and  scrutinize  the  proposed  revision  to  Hong  Kong's  extradition  law.

HK  govt  slams  US  hypocrisy  over  ‘autonomy  act'. The  HKSAR  govt  on  Thursday  hit  back  at  the  US  for  the  hypocrisy  and  hegemony  evident  in  its  so-called  Hong  Kong  Autonomy  Act.

Govt  should  pursue  'multipronged  approach'  in  boosting  land  supply. The  govt  should  consider  land  reclamation  and  developing  brownfield  sites,  areas  in  the  New  Territories  and  the  outskirts  of  country  parks.

Interview  with  CE  on  HK  trade  office  in  Bangkok  &  more. CE  Carrie  Lam  opened  up  about  her  choice  of  location  of  HK's  third  trade  office  in  ASEAN,  Brexit,  China-US  trade  tensions,  fintech  and  more.

Direct  high-speed  train  service  launched  between  Tianjin,  HK. The  G305  train  departing  Tianjin  at  10:58  am  will  arrive  10  hours  later  at  Hong  Kong  West  Kowloon  Station,  according  to  Tianjin's  railway  authorities.
HK  premium  office  space  world's  most  expensive  again. Occupancy  costs  in  Central  area  are  60%  higher  than  New  York's  Midtown,  JLL's  Premium  Office  Rent  Tracker  showed.

HK:  Groups  gather  to  show  patriotism  amid  chaos. A  group  of  about  40  people  gathered  at  the  Golden  Bauhinia  Square  in  a  show  of  solidarity  and  patriotism  ahead  of  the  National  Day​.

Chief  Executive  Carrie  Lam  to  visit  Japan. Chief  Executive  Carrie  Lam  Cheng  Yuet-ngor  will  visit  Japan  from  Oct  29  to  Nov  2,  according  to  a  government  press  release  on  Monday.

HK  sees  48  new  virus  cases,  steps  up  checks  on  imported  meat. The  Executive  Council  will  end  its  summer  recess  early  and  resume  regular  meetings  from  Tuesday  to  handle  anti-epidemic  work  and  other  matters.

More  cars  allowed  on  Hong  Kong-Zhuhai-Macao  Bridge. The  Transport  Department  has  announced  to  increase  the  quotas  for  non-commercial  private  cars  using  the  bridge  to  Macao  by  500.
Hong  Kong  stocks  close  0.93%  lower. Hong  Kong  stocks  closed  down  247.77  points,  or  0.93  percent,  to  26,323.69  points.

Arrests  after  vandalism  in  Tseung  Kwan  O. Radicals  damaged  traffic  lights,  dug  up  bricks  on  the  sidewalk  and  threw  them  on  the  thoroughfare  in  Tseung  Kwan  O  before  police  moved  in.

15  activists  appear    in  court  for  roles  in  illegal  assemblies. 15  opposition  figures,  including  Jimmy  Lai  Chee-ying,  appeared  in  court  on  Monday  for  their  roles  in  violent  protests  in  Hong  Kong  last  year.

Qianhai  further  eases  curbs  for  HK,  Macao  investments. Qianhai  will  further  lower  its  threshold  for  investment  and  work  to  eliminate  all  curbs  on  HK  and  Macao  firms  to  invest  in  the  FTZ,  according  to  new  regulations.

Legislators  laud  chief  executive's  community  dialogue. The  HK  leader's  first  community  dialogue  was  a  step  forward  to  address  the  deep-rooted  problems  behind  unrest,  pro-establishment  lawmakers  said  on  Friday.

Triple  antiviral  drug  shows  early  promise  in  COVID-19  trial. The  HKU  trial  showed,  on  average,  people  who  got  the  triple  drug  reached  the  point  of  no  detectable  virus  five  days  earlier  than  those  in  the  control  group.

Hong  Kong’s  BEA  presses  ahead  with  life  insurance  sale. BEA  could  raise  about  US$500  million  to  US$600  million  from  a  potential  deal,    according  to  people  familiar  with  the  matter.

Bay  Area  benefits  —  the  sky's  the  limit,  experts  say. Hong  Kong's  advantages  in  logistics,  aviation,  as  well  as  innovation  and  technology,  will  help  push  forward  the  region's  development,  a  lawmaker  said.

HK  property  market  ‘heading  for  downturn  year’. Prices  of  private  residential  apartments  had  declined  by  7.2%  as  of  November  2018,  compared  with  the  peak  in  July  the  same  year,  data  showed.

Yum  China  is  said  to  file  for  US$2b  Hong  Kong  listing. Yum  China,  the  mainland's  biggest  fast-food  chain  operator,  is  said  to  have  filed  confidentially  for  a  HK  listing  that  could  raise  about  US$2  billion.

Educators  condemn  violence;  call  for  dialogues. Higher  education  sector  strongly  condemned  the  legCo  attack,  calling  for  an  open  attitude  toward  rational  conversation  to  resolve  disputes.

1st  chartered  flights  bring  back  244  HK  residents  from  Hubei. Pregnant  women,  DSE  candidates  and  those  requiring  medical  attention  are  among  the  first  batch  of  HK  residents  flying  back  home.

CE  attends  Lindau  Nobel  Lureate  Meeting. Carrie  Lam  welcomed  young  scientists  from  different  countries  to  participate  in  the  development  of  Hong  Kong  and  the  Greater  Bay  Area.

Finance  chief  cautions  borrowers  as  HKMA  shores  up  dollar. HKMA's  move  to  spend  HK$51.3  billion  to  defend  the  local  currency  helped  drive  the  city's  three-month  interbank  rate  to  its  highest  level  in  almost  a  decade.
Xie:  We're  confident  in  fighting  virus. Commissioner  appeals  for  rationality,  fairness  in  viewing  country’s  efforts  to  curb  epidemic.
Esports  to  spur  gaming  sector. Game  companies  banking  on  ‘No  1  driving  force’  to  reach  global  audience.

HK  reports  lowest  increase  in  virus  cases  since  early  July. HK  reported  six  new  coronavirus  cases  on  Tuesday,  the  lowest  daily  increase  since  the  city's  third  wave  of  infections  started  in  early  July,  health  officials  said.
Support  face  mask  ban. Hong  Kong  SAR  Chief  Executive  Carrie  Lam  Cheng  Yuet-ngor  ​said  the  decision  to  adopt  a  ban  is  a  hard  but  a  necessary  one  for  the  public's  interest.

HK  govt:  Demand  for  passing  US  bill  on  SAR  regretful. A  spokesman  for  the  HKSAR  government  reiterated  that  foreign  legislatures  should  not  interfere  in  any  form  in  Hong  Kong’s  internal  affairs.

Second  Belt  and  Road  joint  conference  set  for  Friday. The  meeting,  to  be  held  in  Beijing,  will  discuss  work  priorities  and  suggestions  related  to  promoting  Hong  Kong's  participation  in  the  BRI​.

Pro-establishment  lawmakers  condemn  attempts  to  block  National  Anthem  Bill. Bill  to  be  put  to  a  vote  next  week  at  the  earliest  after  filibusters  in  LegCo  by  opposition  camp  who  'collaborated'  with  participants  of  unauthorized  rallies  on  the  streets.
Hong  Kong  stocks  close  0.54%  higher. The  Hang  Seng  Index  gained  132.65  points  to  close  at  24,918.78  points  on  Friday.

Bay  Area  plan  aims  for  world  leading  center. The  development  plan  is  aimed  at  turning  the  11-city  cluster  into  an  innovation  and  technology  hub  and  a  pillar  for  the  Belt  &  Road  Initiative.

4  new  coronavirus  cases  reported  in  Hong  Kong. HK  on  Wednesday  reported  4  more  confirmed  cases  of  the  coronavirus,  bringing  the  city’s  tally  to  89,  with  one  more  suspected  case.
InnoTech  Expo  to  highlight  nation's  sci-tech  landmarks. ​Unique  event  will  showcase  impressive  achievements  from  both  ancient  and  modern  times.
HK  suspends  import  of  poultry  products  from  Landes,  France. The  decision  was  made  in  view  of  an  outbreak  of  low-pathogenic  H5N2  avian  influenza  in  Landes.
HK's  IT  industry  facing  increasing  competition  for  talent. A  boost  in  development  is  leading  to  a  shortage  of  qualified  professionals,  says  IT  recruiter.

HK  govt  to  step  up  measures  against  child  abuse. Communication  and  collaboration  will  be  stepped  up  among  schools,  non-governmental  organizations  and  the  Social  Welfare  Department.

HKMAO,  liaison  office  urge  HK  to  improve  education  system. The  Hong  Kong  and  Macao  Affairs  Office  and  liaison  office  said  education  system  in  the  HKSAR  must  be  in  line  with  "one  country,  two  systems".

Police  safety  teams  enter  PolyU  campus,  vow  no  arrests. Senior  police  officer  Chow  Yat-ming  said  the  focus  of  the  operation  is  not  to  arrest  any  holdouts  but  on  removing  hazardous  items  and  to  gather  evidence.

NPCSC  decision  on  LegCo's  continued  operation  gazetted. According  to  the  gazette,  the  6th  LegCo  of  the  HKSAR  is  to  continue  to  discharge  duties  for  not  less  than  one  year  until  the  7th  term  of  office  begins.

Ann  Hui  talks  about  winning  Golden  Lion. Ann  Hui  became  the  first  Chinese  director  to  winn  a  Golden  Lion  award  for  lifetime  achievement  at  the  77th  Venice  Film  Festival  last  week.

HK  sees  33  new  virus  cases,  in  sharp  decline  from  recent  weeks. New  infections  have  sustained  a  decline  since  the  peak  of  145  local  cases  on  July  30  and  have  stayed  below  a  hundred  daily  since  Aug  3.

HK  database  launched  for  BRI  projects. The  platform  tells  investors  of  the  latest  trends  and  policies  of  BRI  markets,  with  a  database  for  high-demand  projects,  visualized  and  interactive  maps.

CE  pledges  more  efforts  to  connect  with  young  people. Lam  said  she  will  overhaul  the  Youth  Development  Commission  and  to  hold  more  open  talks  to  listen  to  views  of  the  youth  from  different  backgrounds.
Young  Cantonese  Opera  stars  from  HK  impress  Beijing. Hong  Kong  child  performers  are  keen  to  encourage  more  people  to  appreciate  the  unique  art  form.

The  US$4.4b  HK  residential  enclave  that  cost  US$41,000. The  Kadoorie  family  has  shown  what  quiet  perseverance  can  accomplish  in  a  world  where  brash  millionaires  are  increasingly  being  minted  overnight.
US-listed  mainland  tech  giants  ‘moving  back  to  HK’. Some  of  the  Chinese  mainland’s  tech  giants  listed  in  the  United  States  may  be  making  a  beeline  back  to  Hong  Kong.

HKMA,  PBOC  ink  pact  on  blockchain  collaboration. The  connection  is  expected  to  provide  firms  in  HK  and  mainland  with  more  convenient  trade  finance  services.  A  trial  is  expected  to  begin  in  2020.

HK  'facing  community  outbreak'  as  local  COVID-19  cases  jump. HK  was  facing  another  community  outbreak  of  the  coronavirus  after  reporting  mostly  imported  infections  in  recent  months,  a  health  official  said.
Hong  Kong  stocks  pull  back,  led  by  financials,  tech  shares. Hong  Kong  stocks  pulled  back  on  Thursday  from  a  two-week  high  hit  in  the  previous  session.

A  momentous  journey  to  nation’s  future. Annie  Wu  Suk-ching  —  one  of  the  first  Hong  Kong  entrepreneurs  to  invest  on  the  Chinese  mainland  —  has  lived  to  witness  the  historic  rise  of  China  from  a  rustic  backwater  to  the  world’s  No  2  economic  powerhouse.

One-third  of  Li  Ka-shing's  wealth  is  a  US$11b  Zoom  stake. The  tycoon,  best  known  for  building  some  of  the  most  iconic  skyscrapers  to  dot  HK's  skyline,  first  invested  in  the  video-conferencing  app  in  2013.

GBA  draws  top  talents  for  digital  economy. A  study  reveals  that  talent  is  pouring  into  the  Greater  Bay  Area,  buttressing  the  city  cluster's  position  as  a  key  player  in  the  global  digital  economy.

Ex-minister:  HK  'vital  in  nation's  sci-tech  drive'. Former  science  minister  Wan  Gang  said  Hong  Kong's  talent  pool,  international  ties  give  it  a  key  role  in  creating  technology  superpower.

IPO  in  HK:  Bezos-backed  cancer  startup  'to  seek  to  raise  US$1b'. Cancer-detection  startup  Grail  Inc  is  planning  an  initial  public  offering  in  Hong  Kong  this  year,  people  with  knowledge  of  the  matter  have  said.

HKSAR,  Belarus  to  mutually  extend  visa-free  period. The  period  of  visa-free  entry  for  HKSAR  passport  holders  to  Belarus  will  be  extended  from  14  days  to  30  days  with  effect  from  April  10,  and  vice-versa.
Professor  sentenced  to  life  for  killing  wife,  daughter  in  HK. Jury  finds  Malaysian  professor  guilty  of  murdering  wife  and  daughter  with  lethal  yoga  ball.

HK  to  enhance  sci-tech  ties  with  Guangdong. HKTDC  chief  said  research  and  development,  traditional  industries  and  services  need  to  be  aligned  to  realize  global  science-hub  ambition.

HK  supermarket  chains  told  not  to  use  discounts  to  'give  back'. Citing  unquantifiability  and  lack  of  transparency,  the  HK  govt  turned  down  the  proposal  of  ParknShop  &  Wellcome  to  offer  discounts  to  all  customers.

Shouting  'Liberate  Hong  Kong'  could  land  you  in  hot  water. Political  and  business  leaders  support  SAR  govt's  stand  that  a  cry  connotes  separatism  or  subversion  proscribed  by  the  national  security  law  now  in  force.

Hong  Kong  pulls  out  all  the  stops  in  world  IPO  race. Hong  Kong  Exchanges  and  Clearing  is  going  all  out  to  retain  its  crown  in  the  global  IPO  rankings.    As  Edith  Lu  reports,  the  SAR  has  set  its  sights  on  attracting  enterprises  in  the  Asia  Pacific  to  list  in  the  city,  and  is  looking  to  Shanghai’s  new  technology-focused  board  to  attract  more  investors  to  its  fold.

HK  sees  11  new  virus  cases,  4  testing  centers  now  operational. Chuang  Shuk-kwan,  head  of  the  communicable  disease  branch  of  the  CHP,  said  six  of  the  11  new  cases  were  imported  cases.

Here's  what  analysts  say  about  Hong  Kong  stocks  for  2020. Analysts  from  Morgan  Stanley,  UBS,  Daiwa  and  Goldman  Sachs  foresee  that  HK  stocks  will  likely  deliver  few  positive  surprises  next  year  after  a  meek  2019.
HK  has  a  'special  role'  in  cross-Strait  ties. The  implementation  of  "one  country,  two  systems"  in  SAR  represents  a  positive  model  for  Taiwan,  political  leaders  say.

Private-jet  travel  beckons  as  Asian  market  matures. With  the  quest  for  air-charter  services  given  a  shot  in  the  arm  during  the  coronavirus  crisis,  China’s  private  aviation  business  buoys  with  optimism.

Separate  customs  territory  status  'guaranteed  by  Basic  Law'. The  Chinese  Manufacturers  Association  of  Hong  Kong's  chief  said  the  SAR's  special  trade  standing  is  not  granted  by  the  US  or  any  other  country.
HK  deep  in  recession  as  GDP  dives  8.9%. The  8.9%  year-on-year  dive  in  GDP  was  the  biggest  fall  since  the  government  began  tracking  comparable  data  in  1974.

'Chilly  winter'  for  Hong  Kong  tourism  industry. Lavish  pageants,  cheerful  dancers  and  crowds  of  photo-snapping  tourists,  all  familiar  sights  at  Hong  Kong's  Disneyland,  but  a  frequent  visitor  may  notice  something  missing  from  the  jamboree.

Value  Partners  going  solo  in  bid  to  ramp  up  mainland  presence. Successful  home-grown  fund  manager  drops  stake-sale  talks,  hoping  continuing  deregulation  will  allow  rapid  expansion  in  fast-growing  market.

Think  tank  urges  govt  to  double  land-supply  target. Our  Hong  Kong  Foundation  said  HK  would  need  to  develop  more  than  9,000  hectare  of  new  land  over  the  next  30  years  to  meet  people's  needs.

Competitiveness:  Govt  pledges  support  as  HK  world  no.  2. Hong  Kong  was  ranked  second  globally  in  the  International  Institute  for  Management  Development's  World  Competitiveness  Yearbook  (WCY)  2018.
